Ontological Engineering

Elicitation Techniques. Types (I)
•
Protocol-generation techniques
–
Various types of interviews: unstructured, semi-structured and structured
–
Various types of reporting techniques: self-report and shadowing
–
Various types of observational techniques
•
Rules of thumb
–
Take experts off the job for short time periods
–
Focus on the essential knowledge
–
Collate knowledge from different experts
•
Protocol analysis techniques
–
Used with transcripts of interviews or other text-based information
–
Useful to identify various types of knowledge (goals, decisions, relationships and attributes)
–
They act as a bridge between the use of protocol-based techniques and knowledge 
modelling techniques.
•
Hierarchy-generation techniques (laddering)
–
Useful for building taxonomies or other hierarchical structures (goal trees and decision 
networks)
